results.title: Achievements in salinity control
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of salinity and its effects on irrigated agriculture. Explains the formation of the water table and the resultant salinity due to poor drainage and evaporation. Focuses on a number of strategies and research developments to combat the problem.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs

results.title: 'Riff Raff the re-mix'
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Kids for kids”.
Riff-Raff, an Australian rock musical that launched the well known band “Men at Work” was re-staged at the Union Theatre, University of Melbourne. The musical touches upon the problems, frustrations and hopes of four teenagers living in the ‘80’s. It featured two Year 12 students who were involved in a professional performance for the first time and they discuss how they benefited from the experience. Contains interviews with the writer/director of the musical, Jan McDonald and writer/actor, Phil Sumner.

results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: In panel interviews, staff, students and parents of two schools, Bendigo Senior High and Kurani College, Morwell, discuss issues related to planning, developing and running of a senior campus and a school complex with a senior campus.

results.title: Television violence and children
results.brief_description: Does television violence have an effect on children? This is one of many questions asked of a panel of experts on a subject of concern to parents and teachers. Includes interviews with Dr T Radecky, Chairman of the USA based National Coalition Against Violence. No other credits available.

results.title: Changing Times - Changing Schools: Establishing Victorian Secondary Colleges
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Warren Thomas and Victoria. Ministry of Education

video_links.name: Changing Times - Changing Schools: Establishing Victorian Secondary Colleges

results.brief_description: Educational administrators, teachers, parents and students comment on a range of re-organisation arrangements developed to enable Victorian secondary schools to better respond to todays workforce requirements and the needs of young adults in schooling.

results.title: Michael Connor: in conversation with Conrad Bodman

video_links.name: Michael Connor: in conversation with Conrad Bodman

results.brief_description: Michael Connor, Consultant Curator of ‘Screen Worlds: The Story of Film, Television and Digital Culture’, is in conversation with Conrad Bodman, ACMI’s Head of Exhibitions. Connor discusses both the overall concept and the separate sections of the exhibition. Connor and Bodman discuss some of the challenges of choosing, sourcing and exhibiting over a hundred years of creative work and technology relating to the moving image.

results.title: The Teaching Ambassadors: International Teaching Fellowships
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Ministry of Education

video_links.name: The Teaching Ambassadors: International Teaching Fellowships

results.brief_description: Looks at the International Fellowship Scheme which operates in Victoria. Highlights the professional development aspects of the project, the influence visiting participants have on school communities and the input gained by schools upon the return of Victorian recipients. Featured speakers include: Rex Murfett, Susan Gianevsky, Richard Wood, Alex McKnight and Kevin Collins.

results.title: Last resort
